author: Pritha Debroy
title: Gabrielle Union & La La Anthony Sends Tina Knowles Heartfelt Messages After Breast Cancer Reveal - EssentiallySports
text:
Do you remember Cam Reddish’s heartfelt tribute to his Blue Devils teammates’ mother? Before any NBA coach, Debbie Jones stood by Tre Jones as his coach. While Reddish was drafted in 2019, Jones still had another year at Duke. He made a heart touching tribute to Debbie, who was battling breast cancer. Tre added “Momma Jones” with a pink ribbon on the right side of his suit lining. During tough times like these, it’s the love and support of friends that matter most. La La Anthony and Gabrielle Union were quick to send heartfelt warmth to the Grammy-winning artist’s mother.
Both Gabrielle Union and La La Anthony are proud authors. La La Anthony penned her first book, The Love Playbook: Rules for Love, Sex, and Happiness which was released in 2014, chronicling her marriage, friendships, and more. The Bring It On actress, Union, has shared raw confessions and tough experiences in her three books. Another supermom who has raised and supported her star kids, Beyoncé and Solange Knowles has just released her book.
Affectionately known by many as Momma Tina, Knowles has decided to open up about her personal life and stories in her new memoir, “Matriarch,” where she discusses her battle with breast cancer. She was diagnosed at stage 1 in July 2024. She just shared a post on IG to announce the launch of the book.
ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
“I come from a long line of storytellers – strong, powerful women who have shaped who I am today. My family, especially the women, have always been my inspiration, teaching me to embrace my power and pass it down to the next generation,” the caption read. Both Anthony and Union shared clips on their IG stories to express their love and support. “Congratulations, @mstinaknowles. Thank you for sharing your soul with us,” Union wrote.
“Congratulations, Momma T., @mstinaknowles on your MATRIARCH book release today!!!! Love you always!!!! Can’t wait to read this!!!” Anthony captioned her story. The two appreciated her courage to open up about personal struggles. “Matriarch” not only shares Knowles’ battles but also gives a glimpse into her personal life and experiences. Oprah Winfrey announced that this is the latest selection for her renowned Oprah’s Book Club.
View this post on Instagram
ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
Union’s husband, the Miami Heat Dwyane Wade, has also recently opened up about his cancer diagnosis.
What’s your perspective on:
Is sharing personal struggles publicly a sign of strength or vulnerability in today's world?
Have an interesting take?
Dwyane Wade spoke about his kidney cancer diagnosis
Wade, on his podcast “The Why With Dwyane Wade,” revealed that he had just wanted a minor checkup. He had a weaker urine stream and slight stomach discomfort. While athletes are used to routine checkups, they often skip them after retirement.
ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
Since his father was diagnosed with prostate cancer, he wanted to get a checkup just to be sure. He decided to undergo a full-body exam. During the checkup, the doctors noticed a questionable mass on his kidney. He was nervous when the doctor suggested that surgery was the only way to determine if it was cancerous.
Wade had undergone surgeries before, but this was different. After much thought, he agreed and chose to have surgery, during which 40 percent of his kidney was removed. This was way back in 2023. It took Wade a long time to open up about it. It was a tough experience for both Wade and his family. “(Don’t) be afraid to open up and tell someone what you’re feeling. … I’m here and cancer-free because I let the ones that love me love me,” the Miami Heat legend told USA Today. By doing so, Wade has empowered others to do the same.
ADVERTISEMENT
"Is sharing personal struggles publicly a sign of strength or vulnerability in today's world?"

author: /cronologia/-/meta/christian-vindel
title: Denil Maldonado fue expulsado con el Universitatea Craiova en la Conference League
text: MARIBOR, ESLOVENIA.- La primera experiencia del hondureño Denil Maldonado en torneos europeos no ha salido nada bien. El defensa catracho se encontraba disputando la segunda ronda preliminar de la Conference League con su equipo, el Universitatea Craiova, ante Maribor de Eslovenia, cuando vio la roja directa al minuto 29 del partido. Maldonado abandonó el terreno de juego tras ser expulsado, la sanción llegó después de una falta infantil que cometió el catracho cuando el atacante Etienne Beugre del Maribor se escapaba con peligro hacia el área rival. La acción de Denil se produjo en un momento crucial del partido, cuando el elenco esloveno estaba presionando para abrir el marcador. El jugador del Maribor había logrado desmarcarse y se encontraba en una clara oportunidad de gol cuando Maldonado intervino de manera poco inteligente cometiendo una falta que el árbitro consideró merecedora de una tarjeta roja directa. La decisión dejó al Universitatea Craiova en desventaja numérica, complicando aún más su estrategia defensiva que fue rota por Jan Repas al 57’ y Arnel Jakupovic al 88’ por lo que el equipo rumano buscará remontar el marcador para soñar con clasificar a la fase de grupos de la Conference League. El defensor hondureño Denil Maldonado salió frustrado y molesto tras quedarse sin la opción de terminar el partido, además, el jugador no podrá disputar el encuentro de vuelta en casa de su equipo.

author: Edu Rolemberg
title: Última chance de 2023: Samsung Galaxy S23 FE está com R$200 OFF
text:

Imagine-se explorando o mundo do 5G com a velocidade impressionante proporcionada pelo

Seja para transmitir seus vídeos favoritos em alta definição ou baixar aplicativos num piscar de olhos, a conectividade 5G oferece uma experiência revolucionária. E para aqueles que não abrem mão de uma tela imersiva, o aparelho da Samsung

A cereja do bolo, porém, está na poderosa câmera tripla traseira de 50Mp + 12Mp + 10Mp, que transforma cada clique em uma obra de arte. Seja para capturar paisagens deslumbrantes, retratos memoráveis ou momentos espontâneos, a qualidade das imagens surpreenderá até os mais exigentes fotógrafos amadores.
Mas as surpresas não param por aí: a selfie de 10Mp proporciona fotos impecáveis para quem adora registrar seu próprio estilo. E para os aficionados por tecnologia, o processador Exynos 2200 e a opção de até 4 versões de sistema operacional garantem um desempenho personalizado, adaptando-se às necessidades de cada usuário.
Já o dual chip e e-SIM oferecem flexibilidade para gerenciar suas conexões, enquanto a promessa de até 5 anos de atualizações de segurança mantém o
Galaxy S23 FE
sempre atualizado e protegido. E para aqueles que valorizam a praticidade, a opção de entrega gratuita garantida pela Amazon ainda está disponível, trazendo o tão desejado smartphone até a porta da sua casa.

author: Vatican News
title: Nicaragua, otros dos sacerdotes detenidos
text:
Nicaragua, otros dos sacerdotes detenidos
L'Osservatore Romano
La policía detuvo ayer a monseñor Carlos Avilés y al padre Héctor Treminio, vicario general y ecónomo respectivamente de la diócesis de Managua.
Según fuentes locales, los dos sacerdotes fueron detenidos después de que rezaran por Monseñor Rolando José Álvarez Lagos, obispo de Matagalpa y administrador apostólico de la diócesis de Estelí, condenado a 26 años de cárcel, sin el debido proceso, acusado de conspiración, difusión de noticias falsas, obstrucción a la justicia y desacato a las autoridades. Monseñor Álvarez se encuentra en prisión desde el pasado mes de febrero, tras permanecer en arresto domiciliario desde agosto de 2022.
Con Monseñor Avilés y el Padre Treminio, suman seis los sacerdotes detenidos en Nicaragua en la última semana. El 20 de diciembre, la policía había detenido a otro obispo, Monseñor Isidoro del Carmen Mora Ortega, titular de la diócesis de Siuna. Según la prensa local, también fue detenido por haber rezado públicamente por Monseñor Álvarez durante una homilía. Junto con Monseñor Mora, también fueron detenidos los seminaristas Alester Sáenz y Tony Palacio.
